text: Marvel tea eggs are one of my favorite
Taiwanese snacks they're super popular
in China and Taiwan and so common in
Taiwan that they sell them at the local
7-eleven in Mandarin we call this taya
then and the eggs are beautifully
marbled because they've been simmering
in this fragrant and delicious spiced
tea liquid so today I am super excited
to be partnering with tea box to show
you guys how to make my childhood Marvel
tea egg recipe using some of their
fragrant black loose leaf teas it is
going to be super fun and easy so let's
get started for this recipe we'll need a
few basic ingredients I'm starting with
half a dozen soft-boiled eggs now I just
went ahead and use my egg cooker to cook
these earlier I only soft-boiled them
because we'll be cooking them later to
make the marbling just take the back of
the spoon and firmly crack the egg all
around the deeper the cracks the more
marbling we'll get so don't be shy
okay we will also need half a cup of soy
sauce a quarter teaspoon of five-spice
powder 1 tablespoon of rock sugar now if
you don't have rock sugar you can also
use 1 tablespoon of cane sugar instead
and finally 3 tablespoons of black tea
leaves I'm using tee boxes margaret's
hope spring black which will give the
eggs a nice tea flavor now totally
optional but if you want to spice things
up a bit for a bit extra flavor you can
go ahead and add some whole spices I'm
using 2 star anis a cinnamon stick and a
quarter teaspoon of cloves
every recipe is unique so go ahead and
make it your own then put all those
ingredients into a pot along with 4 cups
of water and now we're ready to cook
bring everything to a gentle boil and
let the eggs simmer and cook for 30 to
40 minutes stir every now and then if
needed and after 30 to 40 minutes turn
the heat off and cover and let the eggs
cool and steep in the broth for another
three to four hours after that they're
ready to peel and eat
so that's how easy it is to make these
marble tea eggs they're super satisfying
when you're hungry
but they also go great with rice in a
bento box or even some homemade ramen
soup today though I'm going to be
pairing this with some tea box jasmine
green tea that I brewed earlier mmm
because it's always good to pair this
with some tea time to take a bite I love
the bold flavors of the spices yet I can
still taste the delicateness of the team
it's definitely comfort food for me I'm
angel I hope you guys enjoyed this video
and if you haven't subscribed already
I'll leave a link in my video
description and also to where you can
find my printable recipe and find out
more about tea box until then thank you
guys so much for watching and I will see
you guys soon bye
